actor_awards.notes: Derek won a special Golden Globe (Henrietta Award) in 1952 for 'Best Young Box Office Personality'. He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for Television in 1960.

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: The noble, stone-cutting Hebrew slave who becomes the devoted military commander and successor to Moses, leading his people into the Promised Land.
filmography.plot: The Egyptian Prince Moses learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Cheers (#79), 100 Heroes & Villains (Moses #43)

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A compassionate Arab mukhtar who has been a lifelong friend to the protagonist Ari Ben Canaan, but finds himself tragically torn between his friendship and the rising political tensions.
filmography.plot: The state of Israel is created in 1948, leading to war with its Arab neighbors.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Music (Score); Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Sal Mineo); AFI: 100 Years of Film Scores (#76)

filmography.title: All the King's Men
filmography.role_description: The football-star son of Governor Willie Stark, whose personal tragedies and eventual injury become political tools for his ruthless father.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Picture, Best Actor (Broderick Crawford), Best Supporting Actress (Mercedes McCambridge); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#77)

filmography.title: Knock on Any Door
filmography.role_description: A troubled, handsome hoodlum from the slums on trial for killing a cop, who famously lives by the motto: 'Live fast, die young, and have a good-looking corpse.'
filmography.plot: An attorney defends a young man accused of murder, arguing that his client is a victim of his environment.

filmography.title: Run for Cover
filmography.role_description: A crippled young man who is mentored by a veteran ex-con (James Cagney) but struggles with bitterness and loyalty in the Old West.
filmography.plot: A man mistaken for a train robber is appointed sheriff and tries to help a young man crippled by the same posse that hunted him.

filmography.title: I'll Be Seeing You
filmography.role_description: A small but early supporting role as a military officer in this romantic drama about a shell-shocked soldier and a convict on furlough.
filmography.plot: A soldier suffering from combat fatigue meets a young woman on Christmas furlough from prison and their mutual loneliness blossoms into romance.

filmography.title: Scandal Sheet
filmography.role_description: An ambitious ace reporter for a tabloid newspaper who idolizes his editor, unaware that the man he admires is the murderer he is hunting.
filmography.plot: The editor of a New York tabloid newspaper accidentally kills his wife and then assigns his protégé reporter to investigate the crime.

filmography.title: The Family Secret
filmography.role_description: A young man who accidentally kills his best friend and is urged by his mother to cover it up, creating a moral crisis for his lawyer father.
filmography.plot: A lawyer faces a dilemma when his son accidentally kills a friend and the family decides to hide the truth.

filmography.title: The Last Posse
filmography.role_description: The adopted son of a ruthless cattle baron who is forced to choose between his loyalty to his father and the truth.
filmography.plot: A posse returns from the desert with the money but without the robbers or the cattle baron who led them, leading to a mystery revealed in flashbacks.

filmography.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
filmography.role_description: A young, hot-headed convict released from prison who joins his former partners to recover stolen money in a ghost town surrounded by Apaches.
filmography.plot: Four convicts are released from prison and head to a ghost town to retrieve stolen money, only to be pinned down by Apache warriors.

filmography.title: Rogues of Sherwood Forest
filmography.role_description: The dashing son of the original Robin Hood who reunites the Merry Men to fight against the tyranny of King John and sign the Magna Carta.
filmography.plot: King John resumes his oppressive taxation, forcing the son of Robin Hood to reorganize his father's band of outlaws to fight for justice.

filmography.title: The Outcast
filmography.role_description: A young man cheated out of his inheritance by his uncle who hires gunmen to help him violently reclaim his family ranch.
filmography.plot: A man returns to his home town to wrest his father's ranch from his scheming uncle.

filmography.title: Saturday's Hero
filmography.role_description: A talented immigrant football player who experiences the corruption and exploitation of the college sports system.
filmography.plot: A high school football hero gets a scholarship to a prestigious university but finds that he is treated more like a commodity than a student.

filmography.title: Prince of Players
filmography.role_description: The infamous, flamboyant actor and brother of Edwin Booth who assassinates President Lincoln in this biographical drama.
filmography.plot: The tragic story of the Booth acting family, focusing on Edwin Booth's struggle with his father's madness and his brother's infamy.

filmography.title: Mask of the Avenger
filmography.role_description: An Italian officer in the 1848 war against Austria who masquerades as a Monte Cristo-like avenger to clear his father's name.
filmography.plot: During the Austro-Italian war of 1848, an Italian captain fights to clear his father's name of treason and expose a traitor.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Hajji Baba
filmography.role_description: A clever Persian barber who seeks his fortune and romances a princess while outwitting enemies in this Arabian Nights-style adventure.
filmography.plot: A barber leaves his shop to seek a fortune and ends up escorting a princess to her wedding, facing bandits and romance along the way.

filmography.title: Fury at Showdown
filmography.role_description: A former gunfighter trying to live a peaceful life who is forced to strap on his guns again to protect his brother and girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A peace-loving former gunslinger is forced into a showdown by a corrupt lawyer and a hired killer who want his land.

filmography.title: The Flesh Is Weak
filmography.role_description: A charming but manipulative villain involved in a ring of prostitution in London.
filmography.plot: A naive girl arrives in London and falls for a smooth-talking man who tricks her into working for a prostitution ring.

filmography.title: Sea of Lost Ships
filmography.role_description: A Coast Guard sailor who clashes with his shipmate over the love of a woman and the memory of their fathers.
filmography.plot: Two Coast Guard sailors, raised as brothers, have a falling out over a girl and a past family disgrace.

filmography.title: Prince of Pirates
filmography.role_description: A 16th-century Dutch prince who leads a volunteer navy to fight against Spanish rule when his brother the King fails to act.
filmography.plot: A Dutch prince becomes a pirate to fight against Spanish domination and protect his people.

filmography.title: Thunderbirds
filmography.role_description: A National Guard soldier from Oklahoma who serves in the 45th Infantry Division during World War II.
filmography.plot: The story of the Oklahoma National Guard's 45th Infantry Division as they fight through Italy during World War II.

filmography.title: Mission Over Korea
filmography.role_description: A hotshot, reckless pilot in the Korean War whose careless flying endangers his unit and tests his commander's patience.
filmography.plot: An experienced pilot tries to train a reckless newcomer while they fly dangerous reconnaissance missions during the Korean War.

filmography.title: Nightmare in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A drifter who picks up the beautiful wife of a wealthy rancher, only to be framed for her murder.
filmography.plot: A hitchhiker becomes involved with a beautiful woman and is framed for her murder by her jealous husband and a corrupt sheriff.

filmography.title: An Annapolis Story
filmography.role_description: A naval cadet at Annapolis who competes with his brother for the love of the same girl.
filmography.plot: Two brothers attend the Naval Academy at Annapolis and fall in love with the same girl, leading to conflict during their training and eventual combat.

filmography.title: Prisoner of the Volga
filmography.role_description: A Russian soldier who is unjustly accused and sent to a prison camp, where he must fight for his survival.
filmography.plot: A soldier in Czarist Russia is falsely convicted and sent to a brutal prison camp, where he plots his escape and revenge.
